Home Page

1.  I want to analyse how LFPR of males and females have changed over time in India
2.  I want to analyse how education levels differ for males and females in India

```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

# Load your data 
data <- read.csv("/Users/jaren/Desktop/NM2207 Updated Data.csv")

# Define the user interface
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Gender Differences in Labor Force Participation in India"),
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("year", "Select Year", choices = unique(data$X)),
      selectInput("age_group", "Select Age Group", choices = unique(data$Male.LFPR))
    ),
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("gender_plot")
    )
  )
)

# Define the server logic
server <- function(input, output) {
  filtered_data <- reactive({
    data %>%
      filter(Year == input$X, Age_Group == input$Male.LFPR)
  })
  
  output$gender_plot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(filtered_data(), aes(x = X, y = Male.LFPR)) +
      geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge", fill = "blue") +
      labs(title = paste("Labor Force Participation Rate in", input$year, "for Age Group", input$age_group),
           x = "Gender", y = "Labor Force Participation Rate (%)") +
      theme_minimal()
  })
}

# Run the Shiny app
shinyApp(ui, server)

```

  labs(
    title = "Trends in Labor Force Participation Rates in India",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Labor Force Participation Rate (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
